messages: a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:42): MikeSmith: You around?

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:44): MikeSmith: If not, can you just tell me sometime whether http://stuff a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554.com/spec-gen/html5.html has sane enough indenting of the TOC for your liking (seeming you're the only person apart from me who cares if it is, or at least who has voiced an opinion)?
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (00:47): that looks sane to me
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:47): (I know the end tags are a bit wacky, but being nice with them would result in even crazier code than that needs)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:00): Yay!
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:00): Only one thing blocking release of 1.0b1 now
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:00): (docs)
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (01:10): Is rel="author" meaningful?
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (01:13): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444: in the sense of it being obvious what's intended? it is to me.
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (01:13): Just wondering if anything did anything with it.
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (01:14): like what?
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (01:15): well, actually I guess one could use it when generating a citation
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:18): so i've allowed <a> to contain blocks
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:18): now i have to work out what this does to our definition of paragraph
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:18): because at the moment it doesn't match css's behaviour
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (01:18): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: "oh and by the way, i've just detonated a nuclear device"
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (01:18): "on another note..."
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:19): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444: In Norway?
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (01:19): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: :-)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:19): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444: (I assume that comment is related to #html-wg)
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (01:20): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: I was just commenting on "so i've allowed <a> to contain blocks"
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (01:20): and its offhand form of delivery
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:21): i guess i'll just make <a> elements transparent to the definition, like <ins> and <del>
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:22): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I guess it hasn't much affect, as <a><p>foo</a> is already linked nowadays
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:22): doesn't affect implementations
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:22): affects henri and authos
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:23): though i screwed up the notification when i commited it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:39): http://www.w3.org/mid/<email/> is the most concise description of what IE does i've ever seen
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:39): and hoo boy does it blow most preconceptions out of the water
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:41): It's only concise because it ignores almost all of the details :-p
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:51): Hmm, apparently IE treats unknown tags as empty because if it parsed them as containers then IE3 ran out of stack space on some common bogus content

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (01:59): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, the <xml:namespace prefix=v> thing needs to be a processing instruction, using the SGML syntax, not the XML syntax (i.e. no trailing '?')
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (01:59): so it's <?xml:namespace ...>
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:00): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: It works as both <xml:namespace> and <?xml:namespace>
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:00): I analysed IE's handling of XML crap before http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-forms/2006Sep/0057.html

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:06): IE actually handles both <?xml:namespace /> and <xml:namespace /> in exactly the same way, by adding the <?xml:... /> one to the DOM, which is visible by looking at the .innerHTML of the document
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:11): Does it actually add it to the DOM, or does the innerHTML getter synthesise it for output?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:12): (e.g. adding it just before it emits a tag that uses that namespace)
